problem.display_name: Kraus operator form of quantum operations
problem.p: This is a concept question, provided to check your understanding of the previous video clip.

Suppose [mathjaxinline]\{ E_1,\ldots ,E_ n \}[/mathjaxinline] is a complete set of [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] Kraus operators (also known as operation elements) which define a quantum operation [mathjaxinline]{\cal E}[/mathjaxinline]. Which of the following statements about these operators must be true?

choice.text: [mathjaxinline]\sum _ k E_ k \rho E_ k^\dagger[/mathjaxinline] is a valid density matrix, for all valid density matrices [mathjaxinline]\rho[/mathjaxinline].
[mathjaxinline]\sum _ k E_ k^\dagger E_ k = I[/mathjaxinline]
[mathjaxinline]\sum _ k E_ k E_ k^\dagger = I[/mathjaxinline]

There exists a set of unitary operators [mathjaxinline]\{ U_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] and a probability distribution [mathjaxinline]\{ p_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] such that [mathjaxinline]E_ k = \sqrt{p_ k} U_ k[/mathjaxinline].
